item.description:
Here's the description from the movie site:

This buoyant, illuminating documentary goes beyond doing the horah (although that is part of the story) to a striking panorama of Israeli modern dance, from expressionism to modernism, including footage of Martha Graham arriving in Israel to share her techniques. With vivid performances from many of Israel’s most innovative contemporary choreographers, this film shows how dance has been central to the Israeli story since the pioneering kibbutzniks.

 

The movie is only 52 minutes (my idea of the perfect movie).  There's a discussion that follows, and I'd like to stay for that.   After, we'll go someplace fun for lunch.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be outside the doors until 12:15, then in the theater as close to the center as possible
item.name: Let's Dance: Jewish Film Festival Dance Movie
